meanings.definition: The action of moving to the front or forefront.
meanings.sent1: During the race, the fronting of the fastest runner was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The fronting of the stage by the lead singer caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The fronting of the line by the eager child made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her fronting of the discussion brought new ideas to light.
meanings.sent5: The fronting of the room by the teacher made it clear who was in charge.

meanings.definition: The act of putting something at the front or forefront.
meanings.sent1: The fronting of the book on the shelf made it easy to find.
meanings.sent2: His fronting of the project proposal impressed the team.
meanings.sent3: The fronting of the cake with extra frosting made it look delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her fronting of the presentation with visuals enhanced understanding.
meanings.sent5: The fronting of the store window with new products attracted customers.

meanings.definition: The act of pretending to be something one is not.
meanings.sent1: His fronting as a superhero at the party was entertaining.
meanings.sent2: The fronting of confidence by the shy student surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: Her fronting as a famous singer in the talent show was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fronting of knowledge by the student fooled the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The fronting of bravery by the scared cat made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: The act of emphasizing or highlighting something.
meanings.sent1: The fronting of the important message in the email was clear.
meanings.sent2: His fronting of the key points in the speech made it impactful.
meanings.sent3: The fronting of the mistake in the report was embarrassing.
meanings.sent4: Her fronting of the warning signs saved them from danger.
meanings.sent5: The fronting of the beautiful scenery in the painting was captivating.
